sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Decision day in Turkey as voters head back to the polls for the presidential runoff between incumbent Recep Tayyip Erdogan and challenger Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Vladimir Zelensky has announced fresh sanctions against companies and individuals he accuses of supporting Russia's war efforts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Voters in Turkey are back at the polls today to choose their next president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: After failing to win an outright majority during the first round vote two weeks ago, incumbent populist Recep Tayyip Erdogan is in a head-to-head against challenger Kamal Kilicderoglu, who has promised to restore a more democratic society.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's decision day in Turkey, the second round of presidential elections and this time it seems that the odds are on the side of current president Mr. Erdogan among other things because on the 14th of May the governing coalition took majority in the parliament. When it comes to the last 14 days Mr. Erdogan was talking in the campaign mostly about continuity while his opponent Mr. Kemal Kilicdaroglu, the opposition candidate, has taken a more aggressive stance especially when it comes to migrants. The first round election saw 87% turnout from Turkey's more than 64 million eligible voters and strong participation is expected again today. Polls close at 5 p.m. local time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has announced a new round of sanctions

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: against companies and individuals he accuses of supporting Russia's war efforts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The announcement was made on the same day that Russia said it shot down two long-range missiles fired by Ukrainian forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Russian bombing continues in the Donetsk region. But Ukrainian forces are responding with attacks using improvised drones.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In Kyiv, a monument dedicated to Ukrainian prisoners of war has been inaugurated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian prisoners of war has been inaugurated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Cannes Film Festival's top prize, the Palme d'Or, is staying at home,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: going to French director Justine Trillet for Anatomy of a Fall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: She's just the third woman to win the award.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Trillet used her acceptance speech to issue a l'enrôlement politique en France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Je ne peux pas ne pas venir ici en recevant un prix sans être aussi le témoin, le reflet de ce qui se passe profondément dans la société.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: On vit quelque chose d'exceptionnel cette année, c'était une année vraiment exceptionnelle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: La révolte qui s'est passée dans les rues a été vraiment quelque chose qui m'a...

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Même si j'étais en travail et pas dans l'action, c'est quelque chose qui m'a énormément touchée. Je ne peux pas être séparée de ça. Even if I was at work and not in action, it's something that really touched me.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I can't be separated from that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The film tells the story of a writer, played by German actress Sandra Uhler, accused of murdering her husband.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The festival's other big winner was Jonathan Glazer's The Zone of Interest, based on a book by British author Martin Amis, who died earlier this month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: based on a book by British author Martin Amis, who died earlier this month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of people demonstrated outside the Estonian parliament in Tallinn on Saturday to protest a legislative amendment that would allow same-sex marriage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The amendment, that would also reduce government support for large families, passed the first of three readings earlier this week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Protesters said the law would undermine the survival of the Estonian state by destroying the institutions

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: of marriage and family.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Benfica FC are Portuguese football champions for the 38th time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But this year they had to sweat for the title and wait until the last day of the season to be crowned at the Luz Stadium.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Eagles beat Santa Clara 3-0 before celebrating with fans in the streets of Lisbon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In Germany, the champions also had to wait until the last match day to celebrate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Bayern Munich have won the title for the eleventh year in succession. On a day full of suspense, they owed much to the slip-up of the league leaders Borussia Dortmund.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And PSG set a new record by overtaking Saint Etienne as the team to have won the French League most times. The away tie against Strasbourg earned the Paris team their 11th championship.
